{{also|wetter}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈvɛtɐ/}} * {{audio|de|De-Wetter.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Wetter.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|gmh|weter}}, from {{inh|de|goh|wetar}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*wedrą}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*wedʰrom}} (=*we-dʰrom), from *h₂weh₁- (“to blow”). Compare {{cog|nds|Weder}}, {{cog|nl|weer}}, {{cog|en|weather}}, {{cog|da|vejr}}. ====Noun==== {{de-noun|n||Wetter|Wetterchen}} # [[weather]] # [[storm]] =====Declension===== {{de-decl-noun-n|s}} ====Hyponyms==== {{col3|de |Donnerwetter |Frühlingswetter |Herbstwetter |Hagelwetter |Mistwetter|Nebelwetter |Regenwetter |Sommerwetter|Schönwetter|Sturmwetter |Unwetter|Winterwetter }} =====Related terms===== {{der3|de |Wetteransager |Wetteraussichten |Wetterbericht |Wetterfrosch |Wetterhahn |Wetterkarte |Wetterlage |Wettermeldung |Wetterstation |Wettervorhersage }} ===Etymology 2=== ====Proper noun==== {{wikipedia|Wetter (Ruhr)}} {{de-proper noun}} # a town in [[Hessen]] in [[Germany]] # a town in the [[Ruhr]] district of [[Germany]] [[Category:de:Weather]]
